message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper discusses the use of neural word embeddings in information retrieval tasks, specifically in incorporating local information from relevant documents. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of word2vec Skip-Gram model, which is a popular method in natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the sub-categories of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the effectiveness of neural-based explicit representations, which are commonly used in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Deep Learning (cs.DL) research. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.DL.
